attributes.comment:
When my sister-in-law emailed us the information about the impending increase in
the fee, we were not happy. We believe most families attempting to adopt a child
are already under huge pressure to bring their children home. We believe the
child's country should make every attempt to close the adoption before the
adopting family would have to pay the entire fee again. These families are probably
already receiving substantial assistance from family members, churches,
fundraisers, and all other ways to generate income to adopt. Lets not even talk
about the loans some families take on to adopt a child. These agencies and
adopting countries might think about increasing staff to complete dossiers more
efficiently. This should not be a source of anxiety for families attempting to bring
their children home.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Thomas and Michelle Gordon
